intro: Scorzonera subaphylla, commonly known as the slender scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk, blooming in late summer. Scorzonera subaphylla is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
